subclassFeature.name: Circle of Upheaval
entries: Druids of the Circle of Upheaval embody the element of earth, not as a steadfast protector, but as a destructive agent of change. Their abilities are similarly turbulent, capable of upending even the sturdiest of foundations.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: {@i 2nd-level Circle of Upheaval feature}
Your ties to the tumultuous ground grants you access to certain spells. You learn {@spell mold earth|xge} (or another Druid cantrip of your choice if you already know the spell).

When you reach certain Druid levels, you gain access to the spells in the table below. They count as Druid spells for you, and you always have them prepared, but they don't count against the total number of spells you prepare each day.

subclassFeature.name: Seismic Locus
entries: {@i 2nd-level Circle of Upheaval feature}
As a bonus action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to become a locus of seismic energy.
This form lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you dismiss it (no action required), are incapacitated, die, or use this feature again. While in this form, you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Terraform
entries: When you enter your Seismic Locus, and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can turn a 5-foot cube of ground within 30 feet of you into {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for the duration of your form.

entries.name: Aftershock
entries: Whenever a creature within 30 feet of you enters {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for the first time on a turn, starts its turn on {@quickref difficult terrain||3} or takes thunder damage, you can force it to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or fall {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Earthstrider
entries: You are unaffected by any {@quickref difficult terrain||3} caused by the ground.

entries.name: Tremorsight
entries: You can see any creature within 30 feet of you regardless of its visibility while it's standing on {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

subclassFeature.name: Tectonic Rift
entries: {@i 6th-level Circle of Upheaval feature}
As an action, you can compel the earth to split, creating a fissure that extends out from an area of {@quickref difficult terrain||3} within 30 feet of you in a direction of your choice.

The fissure is {@dice 1d4 Ã— 10} feet deep, up to 10 feet wide and up to 30 feet long. A creature standing in its area when it opens must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or fall in (a creature too large to fall in drops {@condition prone} instead). On a success, the creature moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.
Structures directly on top of the fissure when it opens take {@damage 4d12} bludgeoning damage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shattering Bulwark
entries: {@i 10th-level Circle of Upheaval feature}

Whenever a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to encase it in volatile stone armor for 1 minute, granting it resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for the duration. This effect ends early if you use this feature again.
If the encased creature is hit with a melee attack, the armor explodes out in retaliation, dealing thunder damage equal to your proficiency bonus to the attacker.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 4th level or higher as part of using it.

subclassFeature.name: World Shaking
entries: {@i 14th-level Circle of Upheaval feature}

When you Terraform the ground, you can also cause nearby {@quickref difficult terrain||3} to emit shockwaves. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you standing on {@quickref difficult terrain||3} takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage.
The shockwaves can also damage objects of your choice within this area that aren't being worn or carried.
